page.title: 17 HOME LIFE
page.content: This is how an ordinary family in Highcliffe would spend a Saturday. In the summer they would go to the beach in the morning with a picnic lunch and spend the morning on the beach. After this the family would do the gardening and odd jobs around the house. In the winter on a nice day they might go for a walk, perhaps past Highcliffe Castle and on down to the beach. After this they would go home and watch television or do other things to amuse themselves. Next the family would have their evening meal or tea. This would last about forty-five minutes. When tea is finished, if the family did not play together each person would amuse himself until bed and then the children would go to sleep while their parents watched television or read. By Samantha Tattum and Sarah Jones.
